events.name: Introduction to Google Cloud Platform with Emphasis on App Engine
events.description:
Introduction

Google Cloud Platform (GCP) consists of a set of physical assets, such as computers and hard disk drives, and virtual resources, such as virtual machines (VMs), that are contained in Google's data centers around the globe. Build modern web and mobile applications on an open cloud platform: bring your own language runtimes, frameworks, and third party libraries. Google App Engine is a fully managed platform that completely abstracts away infrastructure so you focus only on code. Go from zero to planet-scale and see why some of today’s most successful companies power their applications on App Engine.

Are you a developer or interested in programing using Cloud technologies? Join us on 28th March 2018 at Outbox technology hub as we introduce to you the Google Cloud Platform and the new community. What shall we cover?

1) Using Django with Appengine.
2) Using Google Cloud Storage and Google Cloud Datastore
with a simple todo list

Outcomes:
Participants will be able to understand GCP in depth, deploy and use Appengine, Cloud Storage and Cloud Datastore.

Pre-requisites:
You may need to install gcloud, python, django.

Facilitators:

Asiimwe Timothy: Timothy is the CTO and Co-founder at Sellio a company that empowers small African firms to grow online thanks to marketing automation and customer service AI.

Timothy is also the Facebook Developer Circles Kampala Lead. Kigenyi Phillip: Phillip is a software developer and former a Google Developer Group lead for Makerere.

Register here https://goo.gl/f3XzRF to provide your details.

events.name: An Introduction to Containers, their Orchestration with Kubernetes
events.description:
Introduction

Because of the benefits of containers, applications have been containerized recently.
Containers have magically changed the way we deploy and manage applications allowing us to build, develop, test, and even deploy applications on a single system with no upgrade downtimes.

What shall we cover?

This talk shall emphasize the different ways we can leverage Containers and Kubernetes to deploy and run robust applications.

We shall talk about how we can containerize and run applications on Kubernetes which is the missing layer that gives us the ability to manage many containers by providing features that enable containers to scale, talk to each other and work in harmony.

Who should attend?

Software developers, DevOps engineers and those who would like to learn about Cloud technologies.

Outcome:

By the end of the talk, participants shall understand containers and how to use them along with how to deploy containerized applications to kubernetes.

Speaker: Joannah Nangyekye

Joannah is a Software Engineering graduate who started her journey as a software engineering trainee at Laboremus Uganda after which she joined Fintech Uganda Limited as a programmer till June 2016 where she contributed to many banking applications during her position a programmer.

She has been developing software in C#, ruby and python. She has worked with ruby frameworks like Ruby on Rails and shoes and Python frameworks like django.

Please register here to attend (Free) https://goo.gl/zmxUKM

events.name: TensorFlow Dev Summit 2018 Extended Kampala
events.description:
TensorFlow is an open source software library for numerical computation using data flow graphs. Nodes in the graph represent mathematical operations, while the graph edges represent the multidimensional data arrays (tensors) communicated between them.

TensorFlow Dev Summit brings together a diverse mix of Machine Learning users from around the world for a full day of highly technical talks, demos, and conversation with the TensorFlow team and community.

Join GDG Kampala and the Google Cloud Developer Community (GCDC) Kampala on the 21st of April 2018 from 8:30 AM to 5:00 PM for a full day event with Keynote speeches and technical sessions.

What are the benefits?
1) Attendees will have the latest update and technology advancement about Machine Learning as well as getting up to date information about Tensor Flow.
2) Attendees who have not tried Machine Learning before can get their hands dirty with it. No software installation required.

Requirements:
Please carry a Laptop.

Who should attend?
All developers and enthusiasts interested in learning about Machine Learning are welcome for this event.

The TensorFlow Developer event is free to attend. Please fill this form to give your details https://goo.gl/ypaFnE

Do not forget to tweet using: #TFDevSummit #Extended @GCDCKampala @GDGKampala

events.name: May 2018 Meetup: Google Compute Engine with Cloud SQL
events.description:
Introduction

Google Compute Engine delivers virtual machines running in Google's innovative data centers and worldwide fiber network. Compute Engine's tooling and workflow support enable scaling from single instances to global, load-balanced cloud computing.

Cloud SQL is a fully-managed database service that makes it easy to set up, maintain, manage, and administer your relational PostgreSQL and MySQL databases in the cloud. Cloud SQL offers high performance, scalability, and convenience.

Join the GCDC Kampala on Wednesday 30th May 2018 at Outbox from 6:00 pm to 8:00 pm as we learn how to use Google Compute Engine with Google Cloud SQL.

What shall we cover?
1) Creating a virtual machine
2) Running an application on Google Compute
3) Setting up Google Cloud Sql
4) Connecting Google Cloud sql with Google compute

Who should attend?
Anyone who wants to learn how to use Google Cloud Engine with Cloud SQL is welcome.

Outcomes
At the end of the event, one should be able to run a virtual machine on Google cloud.

Pre-requisites
Prior knowledge of SQL and any programming language.

Facilitators
Kigenyi Phillip and Innocent Asiimwe

events.name: GCDC Kampala June 18 Meetup: Introduction to Containerization using Docker
events.description:
Introduction

Today’s businesses are under pressure to digitally transform but are constrained by existing applications and infrastructure while rationalizing an increasingly diverse portfolio of clouds, datacenters and application architectures.

Docker enables true independence between applications and infrastructure and developers and IT ops to unlock their potential and creates a model for better collaboration and innovation.

A container platform is a complete solution that allows organizations to solve multiple problems across a diverse set of requirements. It is more than a piece of technology and orchestration.

Join the GCDC Kampala on Friday 29th June 2018 at Outbox from 6:00 pm to 8:00 pm as we introduce to you Containerization using Docker.

What shall we cover?
1) How to containerize an app using docker
2) How to distribute a containerized app

Who should attend?
Software developers and dev ops who wants to learn how about Containerization and Docker.

Outcomes
At the end of the event, one should be able to understand containerization and distribution of a containerized app.

Pre-requisite
None

Facilitators
Innocent Asiimwe

events.name: GCDC Kampala July 2018: Applications of Machine Learning & AI
events.description:
Machine learning has captured the popular imagination, conjuring up visions of futuristic self-learning AI and robots. In industry, machine learning has paved the way for technological accomplishments and tools that would have been impossible a few years ago.

Join the GCDC Kampala community on 20th July 2018 at Outbox technology hub from 5:30 pm to 7:30 pm and learn some of the applications of Machine learning and what opportunities you can take advantage of. Also get a chance to ask the facilitators any questions about AI and Machine Learning.

Machine learning is an umbrella term for a set of techniques and tools that help computers learn and adapt on their own. Machine learning algorithms help artificial intelligence learn without being explicitly programmed to perform the desired action.

By learning a pattern from sample inputs, the machine learning algorithm predicts and performs tasks solely based on the learned pattern and not a predefined program instruction.

Who should attend?
Anyone who is interested in learning and applying ML and AI to solve problems.

Outcome:
At the end of this session, the participants should be able to have a better understanding of Machine Learning and should be able to apply it in industry to solve a given problem.

Facilitators:
1) Benjamin Akera - A researcher at the AI Research Lab in at Makerere University.
2) Clair Babirye - Machine Learning Researcher at UTAMU

events.name: Next Extended '18 Kampala
events.description:
Next Extended events bring together developer communities around the world to experience talks, in-depth product demos and behind-the-scenes interviews.

Get hold of the Next ‘18 experience. Join us on the 7th and 9th of August for the Keynote sessions and Machine Learning Study on day 2 (9th Aug).

Hear from Google Cloud leaders about how the cloud is transforming business, making Artificial Intelligence available to everyone, and improving the lives and circumstances of people around the world in ways never before possible.

See what's new at Google Cloud. A lot, from new enterprise capabilities, to new ways of building apps that link people and data, to harnessing the natural symbiosis of IoT, Big Data and AI to do more, know more, and achieve more.

We shall also have a Machine Learning and Kubernetes beginner study there after.

Content for the ML learning study include 2 Labs:
1) Cloud ML Engine: Qwik Start
2) Cloud Natural Language API

Who should attend?
Anyone who is interested in learning about Kubernetes, Machine Learning and AI.

Prerequisite:
To be part of the study, you need to come with a laptop and also writing material for your notes.

No prior knowledge is required and participation is FREE!

events.name: Next Extended '18 Kampala - Cloud Machine Learning Labs
events.description:
Next Extended events bring together developer communities around the world to experience talks, in-depth product demos and behind-the-scenes interviews.

On day 1, we heard from Google Cloud leaders about how the cloud is transforming business, making Artificial Intelligence available to everyone, and improving the lives and circumstances of people around the world in ways never before possible.

Now join us on the 9th of August for the Machine Learning Study (day 2) where we shall now go practical with Machine Learning.

Content for the ML learning study include 2 introductory Labs:
1) Cloud ML Engine: Qwik Start
2) Cloud Natural Language API

Who should attend?
Anyone who is interested in learning Machine Learning and AI.

Prerequisite:
To be part of the study, you need to come with a laptop and also writing material for your notes.

No prior knowledge is required and participation is FREE!

events.name: Google Cloud Mentorship Program, Kampala - September '18
events.description:
The Google Cloud Developer Community (GCDC) Kampala are launching their first Mentorship program in Partnership with Andela and Outbox with the aim of nurturing young young developers to produce Cloud Experts; DevOps Engineers and Architects.

This program will run with bi-weekly meetups from 15th September 2018 to 23rd February 2019, on Saturdays from 10:00 am to 1:00 pm each meetup.

What shall we cover?
1) Google Cloud Services
2) Automation
3) Networking for Cloud
4) Databases
5) Security
6) Cost implications
7) Introduction to Unix System administration

Who should attend?
Anyone who is interested in becoming a cloud expert; Cloud Architect or DevOps Engineer.

To Apply, please fill this form https://goo.gl/L2dUYX and wait for an email from our team on the status of your application.

Call [masked] for any questions.

events.name: Google Cloud Mentorship Class - Session 1
events.description:
Invite Only session.

The GCDC Cloud Mentorship program starts on 6th October 2018 at Outbox from 10:00 pm.

What shall we cover?
In October we shall look at the following topics:

1) GCP overview
2) Compute Engine
- Spinning up a Linux instance
- Connecting to the instance
+ Console
+ Gcloud cli
- Managing an instance
- Deploy a stateless web app.

Any new interested participants can show interest here https://goo.gl/L2dUYX for the next program.

Join the GCDC Kampala Slack channel here https://goo.gl/MqPsQz

events.name: Google Cloud Mentorship Class - Session 3 [Invite Only]
events.description:
Invite Only session.

It is the 2nd month of the GCDC Cloud Mentorship program with session 3 on 3rd November 2018 at Outbox from 10:00 pm. We are looking for Cloud Experts. Teams are allocated mentors to guide them.

What shall we cover?
In November, we shall look at the following topics:

1) Understanding images
2) Using custom images
3) Build and Provision an image (ansible and packer)

Any new interested participants can show interest here https://goo.gl/L2dUYX for the next program. Please answer any questions elaborately to help us understand you.

events.name: GDG DevFest Kampala 2018
events.description:
GDG DevFests are community-run events that can offer speaker sessions across multiple product areas, hack-a-thons, codelabs, and more.

This year GDG Kampala together with Developer Student Clubs (DSC) will bring to you the Largest DevFest in Uganda alongside other developer communities and Industry players. The theme for this year is "Build for Digital Wellbeing."

Join us on 1st December from 8:30 am to 4:30 pm in Kampala (venue coming up) and experience speaker sessions and codelabs while networking for great opportunities.

We shall cover topics that shape technology today including AI and Cloud, Web and Android technologies.

Who should attend?

1) Software Developers and Engineers
2) DevOps Engineers
3) Tech Enthusiasts

Requirements:
i) Those who would like to get their hands dirty with code are advised to carry a laptop.
ii) It is advisable to come with a team if you would want to participate in a hackathon.

Please fill the form linked https://goo.gl/w5PBYQ to give your details and expectations (Highly recommended).

Video:
Listen to GDG Leads share why they are excited about DevFest season here: https://goo.gl/DibwwZ

events.name: Why teams Need a DevOps Strategy - #DevFest18 Track 3
events.description:
Join us for this session on Saturday 11:00 AM as part of the DevFest 2018 Kampala event.

What shall we cover?
We shall be looking at the contribution of DevOps in the Software delivery pipelines.

Other topic on Cloud will include;
1) TensorFlow and Google Cloud Machine Learning.
2) Testing containers: Using Google’s Container Structure.
3) DevOps and cloud basics / Scaling with the Cloud.

Do not miss the Keynote by Timothy Musoke from Laboremus, a top Norwegian software development company in Uganda.

See details here;
DevFest 2018: https://goo.gl/xxnEYi
Agenda: https://goo.gl/1aDJY1

events.name: Cloud Study Jam Kampala - Machine Learning
events.description:
Do you want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!

Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs.

What shall we cover?
In this particular session among others, you will get hands-on experience with Machine Learning;

1) Introduction to SQL for BigQuery and Cloud SQL
2) BigQuery: Qwik Start - Console/Command line
3) Bigtable: Qwik Start - Command Line
4) Complete to the next quest

Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete any labs you want.

Requirements:
The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed.

Join our slack channel https://goo.gl/R93Vt3

events.name: Hash Code 2019 by Google
events.description:
Google Hash Code 2019 is here!

We’ll be hosting a hub at Outbox for the Online Qualification Round of Hash Code, a team-based programming competition created by Google for university students and industry professionals.

The Online Qualification Round takes place on 28th February at 8:30 PM EAT (17:30 UTC) and registered teams from Kampala are invited to participate from our hub, which will take place on Soliz House, plot 23 Lumumba Avenue.

Top scoring teams from the Online Qualification Round will then be invited to a Google office to compete in the Final Round of the competition in April where they’ll work together to solve another challenge and compete for cash prizes.

If you’re interested in joining our hub, find a team (two to four people) and be sure you all register at https://g.co/hashcode Make sure to select Outbox from the list of hubs in the Judge System.

For any questions, please call Solomon the organizer on [masked].

• What to bring
Laptop, Pen and Paper.

• Important to know
This competition is open to Software Developers.

events.name: GCP Persistent Storage on Kubernetes
events.description:
Managing storage is a distinct problem from managing compute. The Persistent Volume subsystem provides an API for users and administrators that abstracts details of how storage is provided from how it is consumed.

Kubernetes is an open source container orchestration engine for automating deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications.

Join us on Friday 22nd from 5:30 PM to 7:30 PM as we look at how to add new persistent volume on your instances. We shall run a cluster and setup a volume on it.

Speaker:
Joannah Nanjekye is a Software Engineer, Tech Author and a Free and Open Source Software (FOSS) contributor.

events.description:

In Kampala, the Google Cloud Developer Community Kampala will hold a TensorFlow Dev Summit on Saturday 23rd of March 2019 at Outbox Hub from 8:30 AM.

Agenda:

events.name: Cloud Next '19 Extended Kampala - Keynote
events.description:
Next Extended brings together developer communities around the world to take part in the Next ’19 experience.

These events are extensions of Next - allowing local developers to access exciting Next ’19 content and engage with peers across the community through hands-on labs and speaker events.

Join us on Tuesday 9th April 2019 at Outbox for the Key Note. Hear from Google Cloud leaders and customers about how the cloud is transforming business and improving the lives and circumstances of people around the world in ways never before possible.

Among other trends, we shall learn about the future of AI and machine learning, security, directly from the people behind Google products. You can share these insights with your team.

Who should attend?

Developers, Entrepreneurs and tech Enthusiasts.

Share with tags: #Next19Extended #Next19ExtendedKampala.

Join our slack channel here https://bit.ly/2UsATtZ

events.name: IWD Celebration Kampala on Cloud Technologies
events.description:
As part of the IWD Celebration, we shall have presentations from the Cloud Mentorship Program participants on 13th April 2019 from 9:00 AM to 3:00 PM to celebrate their achievements with the Google Cloud Developer Community. This is also open to those who register to attend.

This event will have a special focus on Women but not a women only event.

Topics to be covered include:
1) Infrastructure as a Service with the Google Cloud Platform
2) Basics of the Google Compute Engine
3) The Google Cloud VPC and Firewall Rules
4) Introduction to Packer and Ansible
5) Introduction to Terraform
6) Automated Deployments to Google Cloud using Ansible, Packer and Terraform

Join our Slack Chanel here https://bit.ly/2UsATtZ

events.name: Google IO Extended Kampala
events.description:
Google I/O Extended events are focused on bringing the local developer community together to experience the keynote and other main Google I/O sessions, in real-time. They also offer other unique activities targeted to developers, such as hackathons and codelabs.

On Tuesday 7th and 8th May 2019, GCDC Kampala and GDG Kampala will hold the Google I/O events to show the developer community what opportunities they can have with Google platforms from the Keynote speeches and Codelabs.

Who should attend?
Participants will include;
Developers, Entrepreneurs and tech Enthusiasts.

Join our Slack channel for updates here https://bit.ly/2UsATtZ

events.name: A Deep Dive into IP Addressing and Subnetting, Version Control
events.description:
As wind up with the Google Cloud Mentorship Program, on Saturday, 11th May 2019, we invite everyone interested in Google Cloud technologies to join us from 10:00 AM for a session on IP Addressing and Subnetting.

What shall we cover?

In this session, we shall be looking at a deep dive into Version Control using Git.

Facilitators:
We shall have guest speakers, experienced DevOps Engineers from Andela Uganda, together with our mentors for the Cloud Mentorship program.

The Cloud Mentorship program in Partnership with Andela and Outbox is aim at nurturing young developers to produce cloud experts; DevOps Engineers and Architects.

Join us for more conversation and updates on events on our Slack channel here http://bit.ly/2Wuz1yG (Link expires on 6th June).

events.name: Cloud Mentorship Program Review of Key Topics & Wrap Up
events.description:
We are wraping up the cloud mentorship program and offering support sessions.

Join us on Saturday 1st June 2019 from 10:00 AM at Outbox hub, as we take you through key topics covered during the mentorship program and give more assignments that will help you become an expert in cloud technologies.

In this session our facilitators will also answer questions that you may have regarding any cloud related topics.

The Google Cloud Mentorship program is aimed at nurturing young developers to produce Cloud Experts; DevOps Engineers and Architects.

events.name: TensorFlow 2.0 Global Doc Sprint Kampala
events.description:
TensorFlow 2.0 is a major release focused on ease of use and clarity while maintains its flexibility.

Would you like to contribute to TensorFlow 2.0 and learn the PR and review process? You can get started by improving its documentation.

Join the Google Cloud Developer Community at Outbox as we walk through and improve TensorFlow 2.0 documentation.

Who should join us?
You have knowledge of Machine Learning, TensorFlow or Python but it's NOT a pre-requisite in order to contribute to TensorFlow docs.

Schedule:
05:30 PM - Check-in
06:00 PM - Intro to Machine Learning & TensorFlow 2.0
07:00 PM - Contribute to TensorFlow Docs
08:30 PM - Hands-on & Snacks
09:00 PM - Wrap up

events.description:

group_profile.intro: Am a Software Engineer very passionate about Cloud and communities. Very excited to welcome you to the cloud community.
